data.title: Kenneth Peckosh
data.meta_description: At Cedar Memorial, you will find comfort, dignity and quality at every turn. From our distinctive facilities and grounds to our caring, professional staff. we provide Everything for your family. We pride ourselves in providing innovative funeral and cemetery services to families throughout the Cedar Rapids and Marion area
data.text:
We saw Ken and Shirley many many times during the growing season and always received great advice and laughter. Have missed them both since they sold Peck’s.

Jim and Caryl Valenta

January 13, 2022

Shirley: Really sorry to hear about Ken's death. He was a character in high school and it looks like he never changed. You two and your extended family were wonderful contributors to CR. He will be missed. Big hugs to you.

Susan Harman

December 28, 2021

Shirley, so sorry to hear of Ken's passing. He was a true friend and great guy. Many memories of our camp-outs with Indian Guides & Indian Princess with Brett & Sara and Doug & Kim. My thoughts and prayers are with you and family. God Bless.

Ford Royer

December 23, 2021

Ken was a good man. Always enjoyed stopping at Peck's to talk to him or when he would stop by our shop to visit. Condolences to all.

ROD JASA

December 22, 2021

My condolences to the Peckosh family. Ken was always good to me, I enjoyed our conversations and his advice, truly one of the good guys….. Thank you Ken for all you did for Linn-Mar and the student body. You will be missed. R.I.P. p.s. I will plant a tree on my property for you, just as you taught me.

Phil Katz

December 22, 2021

Shirley so sorry to hear of Ken's passing. He was a Great Guy, he will be missed. My condolences to you and family. jerry

Jerry Mohwinkle

December 21, 2021

Deepest sympathies to our childhood friends Brett, Sara, and Shirley. Loved sitting around the campfire as a child with you all singing songs and watching all the 'grown-ups' be goofy. I'll never forget the many trips to the nursery to see you, and how you made the world a little greener. :) Blessings and peace to you all as you mourn and remember.

Kim Owens (Royer)

December 21, 2021

We were so shocked catching up with the news after a busy weekend to learn of Ken’s passing. There are many fond memories of raising our children together. So many moments to cherish. Our hearts go out to Shirley, Bret and Sara and families. May your memories give comfort and peace. We are so very sorry for your loss.

Mike and Linda Norris

December 21, 2021

Condolences to my childhood family friends Shirley, Brett, and Sara. Many fond memories growing up with Ken and you guys in the neighborhood. Indian Guides, camping, a trip to Wisconsin to watch the Hawkeyes play the Badgers (Hayden Fry years) and just hanging out at each other's houses. Ken always made the times together a lot of fun. Hope you all are doing well.

Doug Royer

December 21, 2021

My condolences to you Shirley and family. . . I was so sad to hear of Ken passing to the great beyond. Loved our times together as either Ken or Shirley coached our kiddos & nephews. We always could depend on you both as well as your staff to never steer us wrong as we inquired about our garden specimens, fixes or problems. We all will miss Ken's whitt and company but not as much as you, his family. May he rest in peace waiting for you to be by his side. Prayers and ((Hugs)) for you all.

Chris Glover

December 20, 2021

Ken and I were best friends during high school. What a rascal he was! He made me laugh so much! He blended the humor with realism and a mind of his own! Loved the Guy! So sorry Shirley. May you find peace in this time from friends and family.

Tom Ferring

December 20, 2021

Our deepest condolences to the entire family. May all your happy memories sustain you! We will be honored to plant a tree next spring in Ken’s honor.

Dale and Deb Rieck

December 20, 2021

Shirley and family. When I got Todd's note about Ken's passing, I was surprised. Vic and I so enjoyed visiting with the two of you at INLA conventions. Guess we never know how long we have on this earth, but we do know that nurserymen (people) are a great bunch of people with long, strong friendships. God bless you all in this time.

Linda Scott

December 20, 2021

Shirley you and your family have our sincere condolences. I enjoyed getting to know Ken thru INLA , loved his sense of humor and always respected him. You two made a great couple. Been many years since we have connected but great memories. Gary and Kathy Fisk

Gary and kathy Fisk

December 20, 2021

So very sorry to hear of Ken's passing. He was a joy! I'll think of him every time I look at our countless Peck's perennials, trees, lawn tools and ornaments. Please take care.

Joyce Stepanek

December 20, 2021

Shirley and family - So sorry to hear about Ken. Keep your memories close to your heart. Thoughts and prayers! Val Holm

Val Holm

December 20, 2021

Shirley and family, I'm so sorry to hear of Ken's passing. Always fun seeing and talking to you all at INLA functions over the years. Dad(Vic) loved your family . Hope there both planting things in heaven for years to come . Condolences to you all.

Todd Scott

December 20, 2021

Shirley, Please know that you and your family are in our hearts today. The obituary honoring Ken was such a beautifully written, loving tribute. Although we cannot attend the visitation today, we will be streaming the prayer service. Sending hugs. Jan and Rick Netolicky

Jan Netolicky

December 20, 2021

Shirley, so sorry for your loss. It's been a very long time since I've seen either of you. My heart aches for your family. Sue (Williams) Benton

Susan Benton

December 20, 2021

Society lost an accomplished man who enjoyed his many selfless contributions to others. As is the case in the current realm, the Peckosh family are comforted knowing he has now passed into the next realm where his concerns and gifts will continue to benefit others.

Bill Strilich

December 20, 2021

Shocked to read of Ken's passing! He was such a great guy! Working for him and the rest of the family was a joy, something you can't say about everyone! Ken was always fun to be with no matter what we were doing including working Hog Wild Days or ringing the Red Kettle Bell! Sympathies to all.

Linda Bendixen

December 20, 2021

Our sympathy to you Shirley and family from everyone at Bailey Nurseries that had the privilege to know Ken and work with you both over the years. Ken was a wonderful man.

Terri McEnaney

December 20, 2021

Our deepest condolences to the entire family. May all your happy memories sustain you! We will be honored to plant a tree next spring in Ken’s honor.

Dale and Deb Rieck

December 20, 2021

I remember Ken standing proudly by his station at Peck's season after season. I loved the way he teased me, treated his customers and ran his business. He was an absolute gem. Sending condolences and love to the entire Peckosh family.

Amy Johnson

December 20, 2021

We are so sorry to learn of Ken’s passing. We hope that your Precious memories will give your family some comfort in the Coming days. Our thoughts and prayers are with you and your family.

Bill and Sandy Butterbrodt

December 19, 2021

We had fun Dude.

Scott Ovel

December 19, 2021

Shirley, so sorry for your loss. Many memories of playing softball and Ken's presence. Prayers for you and your family.

Terry & Pegg Clinton

December 19, 2021

Shirley my heart hurts for you. You have never been out of my heart. You were my best friend when I needed one. You and Ken proved everyone wrong!

Becky Nuzum Cook

December 19, 2021
